intro: Castanopsis schlenckerae, commonly known as the Schlenckerae tanoak, is a species of evergreen tree native to the mountainous regions of southern China and northern Vietnam. It belongs to the Fagaceae family, which includes oaks, beeches, and chestnuts, and is characterized by its hard, durable wood. The plant produces small, cup-shaped fruits that contain one or two seeds, typical of the genus Castanopsis. It thrives in humid, temperate climates and is often found in mixed forests with other broad-leaved species. Due to its ecological importance and ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation areas.
